channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IA

item.title: Report E-2024040114
item.description:
Report E-2024040114

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-09T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-29
  • City: ELDRIDGE
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 29, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon bucket containing UN1139 was punctured while in transit and released approximately two and a half (2.5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew did not have the appropriate PPE and scheduled to return the next day. On April 1, 2024, crews downstacked the pallet and removed one (1) damaged 5-gallon pail from the load. The undamaged pails of freight were wiped down with cleaners and absorbent pads. One (1) 55-gallon drum that contained the damaged pail, and one (1) 55-gallon drum of impacted debris and absorbent pads were staged onsite for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024040112
item.description:
Report X-2024040112

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-09T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-29
  • City: DAVENPORT
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO LEAKING PACKAGE IN THE SORT AISLE. TRANSPORTED TO HAZ MAT CAGE FOR PROCESSING. WHEN OPENED PACKAGE DISCOVERED 2 - 2.5GAL CONTAINERS LEAKING FROM CAPS. INVOICE STATED - RQ UN3017 ORGANOPHOSPHORUS PESTICIDE LIQUID TOXIC FLAMMABLE. NO MARKINGS AT ALL ON OUTSIDE OF BOX. SUPERVISOR CALLED CORP ENVIRONMENTAL COORDINATOR TO COME LOOK AT PACKAGE. RESPONDER CALLED THE HELPDESK. HOLDING PACKAGE FOR FURTHER INSTRUCTIONS.

item.title: Report E-2024040000
item.description:
Report E-2024040000

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-03T15:11:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-29
  • City: CEDAR RAPIDS
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 14:50 PM ET, Liz Frazier with XCR contacted the call center to request a tote transfer for a damaged tote on the dock in Cedar Rapids, IA. The tote consisted of a 275 gallons of Caustic Soda Liquid 50% (UN1834), which was delivered frozen over and with a small crack at the bottom of the container. The amount released is 5oz but it has impacted the pallet and the bottom of the tote. ERTS will dispatch a contractor to flip the frozen tote over on its side, and the transfer will be done once it has fully thawed out. The contractor arrived on-site and confirmed approximately 5 ounces of product was released affecting a 1’x1’ area. The contractor collected and containerized the Caustic Soda Liquid 50% and all clean-up debris into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All waste was stored onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
